SEARCH
Package io.github.jspinak.brobot.datatypes.primitives.match

Class MatchSnapshot

java.lang.Object
io.github.jspinak.brobot.datatypes.primitives.match.MatchSnapshot
public class MatchSnapshot extends Object
Records match results and context at a specific point in time for the Brobot framework.

MatchSnapshot captures comprehensive information about a match operation, including the matches found (or not found), the action options used, timing data, and contextual state information. These snapshots form the foundation of Brobot's learning and mocking capabilities, enabling the framework to simulate realistic GUI behavior based on historical data.

Key components captured:

  • Match Results: List of matches found (empty for failed searches)
  • Action Context: The ActionOptions that produced this result
  • Timing Data: Duration of the operation for performance analysis
  • State Context: Which state the match occurred in
  • Success Indicators: Both action success and result success flags
  • Text Data: Extracted text for text-based operations

Snapshot creation strategy:

  • One snapshot per action completion, not per find operation
  • Avoids skewing data with repeated searches in wait loops
  • Captures representative examples of real-world behavior
  • Stored temporarily as "dangling snapshots" until action completion

Mock operation support:

  • Provides realistic match/failure distributions based on history
  • Action-specific snapshots prevent cross-action interference
  • Enables accurate simulation of Find.ALL and Find.EACH operations
  • Supports extraction of best matches for Find.FIRST/BEST simulation

Special handling:

  • Failed Searches: Empty match list indicates search failure
  • Multiple Results: Text operations may produce multiple strings in one snapshot
  • Reused Matches: Matches used multiple times within an action are recorded once
  • State Association: Links matches to their containing state for context

In the model-based approach, MatchSnapshot provides the empirical foundation for understanding how GUI elements behave over time. By capturing not just what was found but also when, where, and under what conditions, these snapshots enable sophisticated analysis and realistic simulation of GUI interactions.

The extensive documentation in this class reflects its central role in Brobot's learning and simulation capabilities. The detailed timing and context capture enables the framework to adapt to varying application behaviors and provide accurate mock responses during development and testing.

Since:
1.0

      public boolean hasSameResultsAs(MatchSnapshot snapshot)
      Match objects and Text are compared. If they are the same, true is returned.
      Parameters:
      snapshot - the MatchSnapshot to compare
      Returns:
      true if the Match list and Text are the same.

      The Action was successfully performed.

    • isResultSuccess

      public boolean isResultSuccess()
      The Result was successful. Results must be defined by the app. For example, the result of a Click is finding a particular Image. This field can be used to analyze Action options in order to find the best settings for an application.

    • getStateName

      public String getStateName()
      The state in which the image is found gives important information about where and when the state can be found. Mock operations can query this information when an action is carried out in a particular state.

    • getStateId

      public Long getStateId()
